  • Work

ERPsim Admin Console Front-End

Building a new user interface to improve usability and ease of learning.

INTERACTION DESIGN & DEVELOPMENT

    Project Facts

  • Client: ERPsimLab, HEC Montréal
  • Timespan: Summer 2019 - Fall 2020
  • Project Type: Graduate Assistance (Part Time)
  • Tools: Adobe XD & Illustrator, HTML/CSS/JS, React, Git
  • My Role: Workshops, Usability, Visual Design, Prototyping
  • Collaborators: Jean-François Michon (Supervisor) | Félix Lafontaine (Supervisor) | Gilbert Babin (Director-Developer) | Maxime Lardet (Prior Research) | Karl-David Boutin (Reviewer) | Forough Karimi-Alaghehband (Reviewer) | Dana Batog (Reviewer) | Pauline Langlois (Reviewer)

Context

ERPsimLab is an academic laboratory that develops curricula on management information systems and data analysis, by repurposing business software into learning platforms.

Their main product is the ERPsim, a business simulation game for SAP ERP and SAP S/4HANA in which participants use a real ERP system to manage their virtual company in a simulated market. It is currently being used in 170 universities around the world at courses in Bacherlors, Masters and MBA levels.

Challenge

The simulations are set up and controlled from through the ERPsim Simulation Administration Console , a web application that serves as an interface between the SAP system, the Simulation Event Generator, and the end users (Professors and Students).

This project was focused on improving the the experience of using that web application, by pusuing the following objectives:

  1. Simplifying first time usage (ease of learning)

  2. Making the game debriefing data more revelant and focused

  3. Updating visual components to current standards of the web

  4. Preparing the interface for incremental development

  5. Adapting the content to multiple screen sizes (tablet, mobile, desktop)

Outcome

An new web application, developped in using the React.JS framework. Released in June 2021. This application was the product of multiple elicitation, ideation and validation workshops; multiple mockup iterations and html/css ready components. You can see the end-to-end user flow of the first functionning version in the following video:
